meanings.definition: To be filled with excessive and single-minded zeal or enthusiasm for something.
meanings.sent1: She fanaticizes about her favorite band, listening to their music all day.
meanings.sent2: He fanaticizes over his collection of vintage comic books, carefully preserving each one.
meanings.sent3: The young girl fanaticizes about becoming a famous singer one day.
meanings.sent4: His passion for cooking fanaticizes him to experiment with new recipes every weekend.
meanings.sent5: The artist fanaticizes about creating a masterpiece that will inspire others.

meanings.definition: To become obsessively devoted to a particular belief or cause.
meanings.sent1: The activist fanaticizes about environmental conservation, organizing protests and clean-up events.
meanings.sent2: After watching the documentary, she fanaticizes about joining the movement for social justice.
meanings.sent3: The cat fanaticizes about being the ruler of the household, demanding treats and attention.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to charity work fanaticizes him to fundraise tirelessly for those in need.
meanings.sent5: The teacher fanaticizes about instilling a love for learning in all her students.
